docs.snippet: British sterling sold down to $2.79 1/16, last Friday, under the weight of oil company offerings and liquidation of stale long accounts. This was the lowest since mid-March, which ironically witnessed the first stages of an upward movement inspired...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling sold down to $2.79 1/16, last Friday, under the weight of oil company offerings and liquidation of stale long accounts. This was the lowest since mid-March, which ironically witnessed the first stages of an upward movement inspired by a British budget of tax benefits, relaxation of controls and trading in forwards that subsequently carried it to $2.81 3/8, highest since devaluation in 1949.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended May 23, 1952

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 26 -- The United Nations Economic and Social Council adopted today by eleven votes to none, with six abstentions, a draft convention on the political rights of women. It will be submitted to the General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 26 -- The United Nations Economic and Social Council adopted today by eleven votes to none, with six abstentions, a draft convention on the political rights of women. It will be submitted to the General Assembly.
docs.abstract: ECOSOC, 11-0, approves draft conv on pol rights; preamble asks conv opened to UN members and others approved by Assembly; provisions cited; council also approves asking Govts ensure other rights; defeats 2 USSR amendments

headline.main: U.N. UNIT APPROVES RIGHTS FOR WOMEN; Draft Convention on Political Privileges Wins Approval of Economic Council
